title: First law of thermo - adiabatic and isothermal

content.question: An ideal gas in a container with a moveable piston can be taken through the two different thermodynamic processes shown in the <math alttext="P V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>PV</mi></math> diagram. Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is an isothermal expansion and Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is an adiabatic expansion. Which of the following correctly indicates which process would cause a greater change in the absolute value of the internal energy of the gas, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the absolute value of the work done on the gas is greater for Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> than for Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because energy is transferred to the gas by heating in Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> but not in Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the absolute value of the work done on the gas is greater for Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than for Process <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>
Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because negative work is done on the gas and no energy is transferred to the gas by heating

content.answer: Process <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because negative work is done on the gas and no energy is transferred to the gas by heating
